00026 #include "lpc17xx_i2c.h"

00031 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00037 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00039 #define USEDI2CDEV      0
00040 
00041 /* Definition of internal register of EEPROM PCA8581 */
00042 /* 7 bit address */
00043 #define PCA8581_SLVADDR         (0xA0>>1)
00044 
00045 #if (USEDI2CDEV == 0)
00046 #define I2CDEV LPC_I2C0
00047 #elif (USEDI2CDEV == 2)
00048 #define I2CDEV LPC_I2C2
00049 #else
00050 #error "I2C device not defined!"
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 
00054 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00055 uint8_t menu1[] =
00056 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00057 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00058 "I2C demo \n\r"
00059 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00060 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00061 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115.2 kbps \n\r"
00062 " An example of I2C using polling mode to test the I2C driver \n\r"
00063 " EEPROM PCA8581 to transfer a number of data byte \n\r"
00064 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00065 uint8_t menu2[] = "Demo terminated! \n\r";
00066 
00067 /* Data using for transferring to PCA8581 */
00068 uint8_t pca8581_wrdat[] = {
00069                 (0x01<<3),      // Memory Address, data will be written at this address
00070                                         // This internal memory address should be 8-byte alignment
00071                 0x00,   // Data 0
00072                 0x11,   // Data 1
00073                 0x22,   // Data 2
00074                 0x33,   // Data 3
00075                 0x44,   // Data 4
00076                 0x55,   // Data 5
00077                 0x66,   // Data 6
00078                 0x77,   // Data 7
00079 };
00080 
00081 uint8_t pca8581_rddat[] = {
00082                 // Don't use Memory address here, the Memory address to read
00083                 // is the same as Memory Address to write.
00084                 0x00,   // Data 0
00085                 0x00,   // Data 1
00086                 0x00,   // Data 2
00087                 0x00,   // Data 3
00088                 0x00,   // Data 4
00089                 0x00,   // Data 5
00090                 0x00,   // Data 6
00091                 0x00,   // Data 7
00092 };
00093 
00094 /* Transmit setup */
00095 I2C_M_SETUP_Type txsetup;
00096 /* Receive setup */
00097 I2C_M_SETUP_Type rxsetup;
00098 
00099 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00100 int32_t PCA8581_Write(void);
00101 int32_t PCA8581_Read(void);
00102 void print_menu(void);
00103 void Error_Loop(uint32_t ErrorCode);
00104 
00105 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00106 /*********************************************************************/
00111 int32_t PCA8581_Write(void)
00112 {
00113         txsetup.sl_addr7bit = PCA8581_SLVADDR;
00114         txsetup.tx_data = pca8581_wrdat;
00115         txsetup.tx_length = sizeof(pca8581_wrdat);
00116         txsetup.rx_data = NULL;
00117         txsetup.rx_length = 0;
00118         txsetup.retransmissions_max = 3;
00119 
00120         if (I2C_MasterTransferData(I2CDEV, &txsetup, I2C_TRANSFER_POLLING) == SUCCESS){
00121                 return (0);
00122         } else {
00123                 return (-1);
00124         }
00125 }
00126 
00127 /*********************************************************************/
00132 int32_t PCA8581_Read(void)
00133 {
00134 
00135         rxsetup.sl_addr7bit = PCA8581_SLVADDR;
00136         rxsetup.tx_data = pca8581_wrdat;        // Get address to read at writing address
00137         rxsetup.tx_length = 1;
00138         rxsetup.rx_data = pca8581_rddat;
00139         rxsetup.rx_length = sizeof(pca8581_rddat);
00140         rxsetup.retransmissions_max = 3;
00141 
00142         if (I2C_MasterTransferData(I2CDEV, &rxsetup, I2C_TRANSFER_POLLING) == SUCCESS){
00143                 return (0);
00144         } else {
00145                 return (-1);
00146         }
00147 }
00148 
00149 /*********************************************************************/
00154 void print_menu(void)
00155 {
00156         _DBG_(menu1);
00157 }

00159 /*********************************************************************/
00165 void Error_Loop(uint32_t ErrorCode)
00166 {
00167         uint32_t test;
00168         // for testing purpose
00169         test = ErrorCode;
00170         /*
00171          * Insert your code here...
00172          */
00173         while(1);
00174 }

00177 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00178 /*********************************************************************/
00183 int c_entry(void)
00184 {
00185         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00186         uint32_t tmp;
00187         uint8_t *dp, *sp;
00188 
00189         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00190          * – 115200bps
00191          * – 8 data bit
00192          * – No parity
00193          * – 1 stop bit
00194          * – No flow control
00195          */
00196         debug_frmwrk_init();
00197 
00198         // print welcome screen
00199         print_menu();
00200 
00201         /*
00202          * Init I2C pin connect
00203          */
00204         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00205         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00206 #if (USEDI2CDEV == 0)
00207         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00208         PinCfg.Pinnum = 27;
00209         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00210         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00211         PinCfg.Pinnum = 28;
00212         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00213 #elif (USEDI2CDEV == 2)
00214         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00215         PinCfg.Pinnum = 10;
00216         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00217         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00218         PinCfg.Pinnum = 11;
00219         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00220 #endif
00221 
00222         /* I2C block ------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00223         // Initialize I2C peripheral
00224         I2C_Init(I2CDEV, 200000);
00225 
00226         /* Enable I2C1 operation */
00227         I2C_Cmd(I2CDEV, ENABLE);
00228 
00229         /* Transmit data ---------------------------------------------------------- */
00230         _DBG_("Sending...");
00231         if (PCA8581_Write() == (-1)){
00232                 _DBG_("Error while sending data");
00233                 Error_Loop(txsetup.status);
00234         }
00235         _DBG_("Complete!");
00236 
00237         // wait for a while
00238         for (tmp = 0x100000; tmp; tmp--);
00239 
00240         /* Receive data ---------------------------------------------------------- */
00241         _DBG_("Reading...");
00242         if (PCA8581_Read() == (-1)){
00243                 _DBG_("Error while reading data");
00244                 Error_Loop(rxsetup.status);
00245         }
00246         _DBG_("Complete!");
00247 
00248         // Verify data
00249         dp = pca8581_rddat;
00250         sp = pca8581_wrdat;
00251         sp += 1;  // Offset +1
00252         for (tmp = sizeof(pca8581_rddat); tmp; tmp--){
00253                 if (*dp++ != *sp++){
00254                         _DBG_("Verify Data error!");
00255                         break;
00256                 }
00257         }
00258 
00259         tmp++;
00260 
00261     /* Loop forever */
00262     while(1);
00263     return 1;
00264 }
00265 
00266 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00267    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00268    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00269    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00270    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00271 int main(void)
00272 {
00273     return c_entry();
00274 }
